010package imagingbook.pub.color.edge;
011
012import java.awt.Point;
013import java.util.LinkedList;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.Stack;
016
017import ij.plugin.filter.Convolver;
018import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
019import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
020import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
021import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
022import imagingbook.lib.filter.linear.GaussianKernel1D;
023import imagingbook.lib.math.Eigensolver2x2;
024
025/**
026 * This class implements a Canny edge detector for grayscale and RGB images.
027 * The edge detector is "lazy" in the sense that it performs local non-
028 * maximum suppression and edge tracing only when the results are explicitly 
029 * queried (by the methods {@link #getEdgeBinary()} and {@link #getEdgeTraces()}).
030 * 
031 * @author W. Burger
032 * @version 2020/02/08
033 */
034public class CannyEdgeDetector extends ColorEdgeDetector {
035        
036        public static class Parameters {
037                /** Gaussian sigma (scale) */
038                public double gSigma = 2.0f;
039                
040                /** High threshold (20% of max. edge magnitude) */
041                public double hiThr  = 20.0f;
042                
043                /** Low threshold (5% of max. edge magnitude) */
044                public double loThr = 5.0f;
045                
046                /** Set {@code true} to normalize gradient magnitude */
047                public boolean normGradMag = true;
048                
049                /**
050                 * Checks the parameter set.
051                 * @return true if any invalid condition is found
052                 */
053                public boolean isInValid () { 
054                        return gSigma < 0.1f || loThr > hiThr;
055                }
056        }
057        
058        private final Parameters params;
059        private final int M, N;                                         // width and height of I
060        
061        private FloatProcessor Emag = null;                             // gradient magnitude
062        private FloatProcessor Enms = null;                             // non-max suppressed gradient magnitude
063        private FloatProcessor Ex = null, Ey = null;    // edge normal vectors
064        private ByteProcessor Ebin = null;                              // final (binary) edge map
065        private List<List<Point>> traceList = null;             // list of edge traces
066        
067        // Constructor with default parameters:
068        public CannyEdgeDetector(ImageProcessor ip) {
069                this(ip, new Parameters());
070        }
071        
072        // Constructor with parameter object:
073        public CannyEdgeDetector(ImageProcessor I, Parameters params) {
074                if (params.isInValid()) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
075                this.params = params;
076                M = I.getWidth();
077                N = I.getHeight();
078                makeGradientsAndMagnitude(I);
079        }
080
081        //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
082        
083        // do the inital work only
084        private void makeGradientsAndMagnitude(ImageProcessor I) {
085                if (I instanceof ColorProcessor) 
086                        makeGradientsAndMagnitudeColor((ColorProcessor) I);
087                else
088                        makeGradientsAndMagnitudeGray(I);
089                //nonMaxSuppression();
090                //detectAndTraceEdges();
091        }
092
093        private void makeGradientsAndMagnitudeGray(ImageProcessor I) {          
094                FloatProcessor If = I.convertToFloatProcessor();        // always makes a copy
095                                
096                // apply a separable Gaussian filter to I
097                float[] gaussKernel = GaussianKernel1D.makeGaussKernel1D(params.gSigma);
098                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
099                conv.setNormalize(true);
100                conv.convolve(If, gaussKernel, gaussKernel.length, 1);
101                conv.convolve(If, gaussKernel, 1, gaussKernel.length);
102                
103                // calculate the gradients in X- and Y-direction
104                Ex = If;
105                Ey = (FloatProcessor) If.duplicate();
106                float[] gradKernel = {-0.5f, 0, 0.5f};
107                conv.setNormalize(false);
108                conv.convolve(Ex, gradKernel, gradKernel.length, 1);
109                conv.convolve(Ey, gradKernel, 1, gradKernel.length);
110                
111                Emag = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
112                float emax = 0;
113                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
114                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
115                                float dx = Ex.getf(u,v);
116                                float dy = Ey.getf(u,v);
117                                float mag = (float) Math.hypot(dx, dy); // = (float) Math.sqrt(dx*dx + dy*dy);
118                                if (mag > emax) 
119                                        emax = mag;
120                                Emag.setf(u, v, mag);
121                        }
122                }
123                
124                // normalize gradient magnitude 
125                if (params.normGradMag && emax > 0.001) 
126                        Emag.multiply(100.0/emax);
127        }
128        
129        private void makeGradientsAndMagnitudeColor(ColorProcessor I) {
130                FloatProcessor[] Irgb = rgbToFloatChannels(I);
131                FloatProcessor[] Ixrgb = new FloatProcessor[3];
132                FloatProcessor[] Iyrgb = new FloatProcessor[3];
133                
134                // apply a separable Gaussian filter to each RGB channel
135                float[] gaussKernel = GaussianKernel1D.makeGaussKernel1D(params.gSigma);
136                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
137                conv.setNormalize(true);
138                for (int i=0; i < Irgb.length; i++) {
139                        FloatProcessor If = Irgb[i];
140                        conv.convolve(If, gaussKernel, gaussKernel.length, 1);
141                        conv.convolve(If, gaussKernel, 1, gaussKernel.length);
142                        Ixrgb[i] = If;
143                        Iyrgb[i] = (FloatProcessor) If.duplicate();
144                }
145                
146                // calculate the gradients in X- and Y-direction for each RGB channel
147                float[] gradKernel = {-0.5f, 0, 0.5f};
148                conv.setNormalize(false);
149                for (int i = 0; i < Irgb.length; i++) {
150                        FloatProcessor Ix = Ixrgb[i];
151                        FloatProcessor Iy = Iyrgb[i];
152                        conv.convolve(Ix, gradKernel, gradKernel.length, 1);
153                        conv.convolve(Iy, gradKernel, 1, gradKernel.length);
154                }
155
156                // calculate gradient magnitude
157                Ex = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
158                Ey = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
159                Emag = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
160                float emax = 0;
161                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
162                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
163                                float rx = Ixrgb[0].getf(u,v), ry = Iyrgb[0].getf(u,v);
164                                float gx = Ixrgb[1].getf(u,v), gy = Iyrgb[1].getf(u,v);
165                                float bx = Ixrgb[2].getf(u,v), by = Iyrgb[2].getf(u,v);
166                                float Ixx = rx*rx + gx*gx + bx*bx;
167                                float Iyy = ry*ry + gy*gy + by*by;
168                                float Ixy = rx*ry + gx*gy + bx*by;
169                                
170                                Eigensolver2x2 es = new Eigensolver2x2(Ixx, Ixy, Ixy, Iyy);
171                                if (!es.isReal()) {
172                                        throw new ArithmeticException(
173                                                        String.format("No real eigenvalues for structure matrix at position (%d, %d)", u, v));
174                                }
175                                float mag = (float) Math.sqrt(es.getEigenvalues()[0]);
176                                Emag.setf(u, v, mag);
177                                
178                                double[] eVecs = es.getEigenvectors()[0];
179                                Ex.setf(u, v, (float) eVecs[0]);
180                                Ey.setf(u, v, (float) eVecs[1]);
181                        }
182                }
183                // normalize gradient magnitude 
184                if (params.normGradMag && emax > 0.001) 
185                        Emag.multiply(100.0/emax);
186        }
187        
188        //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
189        
190        // perform non-maximum suppression along gradient direction
191        private void nonMaxSuppression() {
192                Enms = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
193                for (int v = 1; v < N - 1; v++) {
194                        for (int u = 1; u < M - 1; u++) {
195                                int s_theta = getOrientationSector(Ex.getf(u, v), Ey.getf(u, v));
196                                if (isLocalMaximum(Emag, u, v, s_theta, (float) params.loThr)) {
197                                        Enms.setf(u, v, Emag.getf(u, v)); // keep local maximum only
198                                }
199                        }
200                }
201        }
202        
203        private void detectAndTraceEdges() {
204                if (Enms == null) {
205                        nonMaxSuppression();
206                }
207                Ebin = new ByteProcessor(M, N);
208                int color = 255;
209                traceList = new LinkedList<List<Point>>();
210                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
211                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
212                                if (Enms.getf(u, v) >= params.hiThr && Ebin.get(u, v) == 0) { // unmarked edge point
213                                        List<Point> trace = traceAndThreshold(u, v, (float) params.loThr, color);
214                                        traceList.add(trace);
215                                }
216                        }
217                }
218        }
219        
220        // Determines if the gradient magnitude is a local maximum at position (u,v)
221        // in direction s_theta.
222        private boolean isLocalMaximum(FloatProcessor gradMagnitude, int u, int v, int s_theta, float mMin) {
223                float mC = gradMagnitude.getf(u, v);
224                if (mC < mMin) {
225                        return false;
226                }
227                else {
228                        float mL = 0, mR = 0;
229                        switch (s_theta) {
230                        case 0 : 
231                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u-1, v);
232                                mR = gradMagnitude.getf(u+1, v);
233                                break;
234                        case 1 : 
235                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u-1, v-1);
236                                mR = gradMagnitude.getPixelValue(u+1, v+1);
237                                break;
238                        case 2 : 
239                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u, v-1);
240                                mR = gradMagnitude.getf(u, v+1);
241                                break;
242                        case 3 : 
243                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u-1, v+1);
244                                mR = gradMagnitude.getf(u+1, v-1);
245                                break;
246                        }
247                        return (mL <= mC && mC >= mR);
248                }
249        }
250        
251        ///Recursively collect and mark all pixels of an edge that are 8-connected to 
252        // (u0,v0) and have a gradient magnitude above loThr.
253        /**
254         * Recursively collect and mark all pixels of an edge that are 8-connected to 
255         * (u0,v0) and have a gradient magnitude above loThr.
256         * @param u0 start coordinate (x)
257         * @param v0 start coordinate (y)
258         * @param loThr low threshold (min. edge magnitude to continue tracing)
259         * @param markColor color used for marking pixels on edge trace
260         * @return a list of Point objects.
261         */
262        private List<Point> traceAndThreshold(int u0, int v0, float loThr, int markColor) {
263                //IJ.log("  working point " + u + " " + v);
264                Stack<Point> pointStack = new Stack<Point>();
265                List<Point> pointList = new LinkedList<Point>();
266                pointStack.push(new Point(u0, v0));
267                while (!pointStack.isEmpty()) {
268                        Point p = pointStack.pop();
269                        int up = p.x;
270                        int vp = p.y;
271                        Ebin.putPixel(up, vp, markColor);       // mark this edge point
272                        pointList.add(p);
273                                
274                        int uL = Math.max(up - 1, 0);           // (up > 0) ? up-1 : 0;
275                        int uR = Math.min(up + 1, M - 1);       // (up < M-1) ? up+1 : M-1;
276                        int vT = Math.max(vp - 1, 0);           // (vp > 0) ? vp - 1 : 0;
277                        int vB = Math.min(vp + 1, N - 1);       // (vp < N-1) ? vp+1 : N-1;
278                        
279                        for (int u = uL; u <= uR; u++) {
280                                for (int v = vT; v <= vB; v++) {
281                                        if (Ebin.get(u, v) == 0 && Enms.getf(u, v) >= loThr) {
282                                                pointStack.push(new Point(u,v));
283                                        }
284                                }
285                        }
286                }
287                return pointList;
288        }
289        
290        private final float cosPi8 = (float) Math.cos(Math.PI/8);
291        private final float sinPi8 = (float) Math.sin(Math.PI/8);
292        
293        // returns the quantized orientation sector for vector (dx, dy)
294        private int getOrientationSector(float dx, float dy) {
295                // rotate the gradient vector by PI/8
296                float dxR = cosPi8 * dx - sinPi8 * dy;
297                float dyR = sinPi8 * dx + cosPi8 * dy;  
298                // mirror vector (dxR,dyR) to [0,PI]
299                if (dyR < 0) {
300                        dxR = -dxR;
301                        dyR = -dyR;
302                }
303                // determine the octant for (dx, dy)
304                int s_theta;
305                if (dxR >= 0) { // dxR >= 0, dyR >= 0
306                        if (dxR >= dyR)
307                                s_theta = 0; // return 0;
308                        else
309                                s_theta = 1; // return 1;
310                }
311                else {  // dxR < 0, dyR >= 0
312                        if (-dxR < dyR)
313                                s_theta = 2; // return 2;
314                        else
315                                s_theta = 3; //return 3;
316                }
317                return s_theta;
318        }
319        
320        public FloatProcessor getEdgeMagnitude() {
321                return Emag;
322        }
323
324        public FloatProcessor getEdgeOrientation() {
325                FloatProcessor E_theta = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
326                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
327                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
328                                double ex = Ex.getf(u, v);
329                                double ey = Ey.getf(u, v);
330                                float theta = (float) Math.atan2(ey, ex);
331                                E_theta.setf(u, v, theta);
332                        }
333                }
334                return E_theta;
335        }
336        
337        public ByteProcessor getEdgeBinary() {
338                if (Ebin == null) {
339                        detectAndTraceEdges();
340                }
341                return Ebin;
342        }
343        
344        public List<List<Point>> getEdgeTraces() {
345                if (traceList == null) {
346                        detectAndTraceEdges();
347                }
348                return traceList;
349        }
350        
351        //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
352        
353        // extract RGB channels of 'cp' as 3 float processors
354        private FloatProcessor[] rgbToFloatChannels(ColorProcessor cp) {
355                int w = cp.getWidth();
356                int h = cp.getHeight();
357                FloatProcessor rp = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
358                FloatProcessor gp = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
359                FloatProcessor bp = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
360                int[] pixels = (int[]) cp.getPixels(); 
361                float[] rpix = (float[]) rp.getPixels();
362                float[] gpix = (float[]) gp.getPixels();
363                float[] bpix = (float[]) bp.getPixels();
364                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
365                        int c = pixels[i];
366                        rpix[i] = (c & 0xff0000) >> 16;
367                        gpix[i] = (c & 0xff00) >> 8;
368                        bpix[i] = c & 0xff;
369                }
370        return new FloatProcessor[] {rp, gp, bp};
371        }
372        
373}
